It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial species. The plant is characterized by its elongated, grass-like leaves that form a rosette structure, often with a central water-holding cavity. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Pinalia propinqua is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
